title: Philip Russell Diplock
text:
Philip Russell Diplock (November 1927 - July 2019) is a British architect. He is the founder of <a href="Russell%20Diplock%20%26amp%3B%20Associates">Russell Diplock & Associates</a>
Early life.
Philip Russell Diplock was born in November 1927, son of Philip Bernard Diplock (a manager at <a href="Capital%20and%20Counties%20Bank">Capital and Counties Bank</a>) and Elsie Margaret Diplock (née Besley). His younger brother was Professor Anthony Diplock, former director of Assured British Meat. <a href="Kenneth%20Diplock%2C%20Baron%20Diplock">Kenneth Diplock, Baron Diplock</a> is a distant cousin.
Career.
Diplock founded Russell Diplock & Associates, an architectural firm. It designed the 18-storey modernist <a href="Arlington%20House%2C%20Margate">Arlington House, Margate</a>, which was built in 1964 by the contractors <a href="Bernard%20Sunley%20%26amp%3B%20Sons">Bernard Sunley & Sons</a>. They also designed numerous buildings in the Brighton area.
